prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning.  Here is the text: One night two young men from Egulac went down to the river to hunt seals and while they were there it became foggy and calm. Then they heard war-cries, and they thought: 'Maybe this is a war-party'. They escaped to the shore, and hid behind a log. Now canoes came up, and they heard the noise of paddles, and saw one canoe coming up to them. There were five men in the canoe, and they said: 'What do you think? We wish to take you along. We are going up the river to make war on the people.' One of the young men said,'I have no arrows.' 'Arrows are in the canoe,' they said. 'I will not go along. I might be killed. My relatives do not know where I have gone. But you,' he said, turning to the other, 'may go with them.' So one of the young men went, but the other returned home. And the warriors went on up the river to a town on the other side of Kalama. The people came down to the water and they began to fight, and many were killed. But presently the young man heard one of the warriors say, 'Quick, let us go home: that Indian has been hit.' Now he thought: 'Oh, they are ghosts.' He did not feel sick, but they said he had been shot. So the canoes went back to Egulac and the young man went ashore to his house and made a fire. And he told everybody and said: 'Behold I accompanied the ghosts, and we went to fight. Many of our fellows were killed, and many of those who attacked us were killed. They said I was hit, and I did not feel sick.' He told it all, and then he became quiet. When the sun rose he fell down. Something black came out of his mouth. His face became contorted. The people jumped up and cried.He was dead.
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning.  Here is the text:
format_prompt: Use the following format for your answers: ##TEXT## your_new_text ##TEXTEND##
stories: ##TEXT## One evening, two young men from Egulac ventured to the river to hunt seals. The weather turned foggy and still. Suddenly, they heard war cries, causing them to contemplate, "Perhaps, it's a war-party." They retreated to the shore, concealing themselves behind a log. Soon, canoes approached, their paddles creating a din. They spotted a canoe nearing them with five men aboard. The men proposed, "What do you think? We intend to take you with us. We're heading upriver to wage war on the tribe." One of the young men expressed, "I don't have any arrows." They responded, "Arrows are in the canoe." He declined, "I won't go. I might be slain. My kin are unaware of my whereabouts. However, you," he addressed the other, "can join them." Thus, one young man agreed, while the other returned home. The warriors proceeded upriver to a village across Kalama. The tribes clashed near the water, resulting in numerous casualties. Suddenly, a warrior exclaimed, "Quick, let's return home: that native has been struck." He pondered, "Oh, they must be spirits." Despite feeling fine, they informed him he'd been wounded. Upon their return to Egulac, the young man returned to his house and lit a fire. He relayed his experience, stating, "Behold, I journeyed with the spirits, and we engaged in battle. Many of our comrades perished, and many of those we fought against also died. They claimed I was struck, yet I didn't feel ill." He shared his entire ordeal and then fell silent. When the sun rose, he collapsed. Something dark emerged from his mouth. His visage twisted. The people screamed and wailed. He was deceased. ##TEXTEND##

##TEXT## Two young men from Egulac went to the river one evening to hunt seals. The weather became foggy and quiet. They heard war cries, leading them to consider the possibility, "Maybe it's a war group." They retreated to the shore, hiding behind a log. Soon, canoes came near, their paddles making a loud noise. They noticed a canoe with five men nearing them. The men suggested, "What do you think? We wish to bring you with us. We're heading upriver to fight a tribe." One of the young men replied, "I don't have any arrows." They answered, "Arrows are in the canoe." He refused, "I won't go. I might get killed. My family doesn't know where I am. But, you," he said to the other, "can join them." So, one young man agreed, while the other went back home. The warriors traveled upriver to a village across Kalama. The tribes fought near the water, resulting in many casualties. Suddenly, a warrior shouted, "Quick, let's go home: that man has been hit." He thought, "Oh, they must be supernatural beings." Despite feeling fine, they told him he'd been hurt. Upon their return to Egulac, the young man went back to his house and lit a fire. He recounted his adventure, saying, "Look, I journeyed with the supernatural beings, and we fought. Many of our companions died, and many of those we battled also perished. They claimed I was hit, but I didn't feel unwell." He shared his entire story and then fell silent. When the sun rose, he died. Something dark came out of his mouth. His face distorted. The people screamed and cried. He was dead. ##TEXTEND##

##TEXT## Two young individuals from Egulac ventured to the river one evening with the intention of hunting seals. The weather turned foggy and hushed. They detected eerie cries, causing them to ponder, "Perhaps it's a war party." They retreated to the shore, concealing themselves behind a log. Not long after, canoes approached, their paddles creating a loud ruckus. They spotted a canoe with five men drawing near. The men proposed, "What are your thoughts? We intend to take you along. We're headed upriver for a conflict with a tribe." One of the young men expressed, "I lack arrows." They responded, "Arrows are in the canoe." He declined, "I won't tag along. I might get killed. My kin is unaware of my location. However, you," he said to the other, "can join them." Consequently, one young man concurred, while the other returned home. The warriors voyaged upriver to a village beyond Kalama. The tribes engaged in battle near the water, causing numerous casualties. Abruptly, a warrior cried out, "Quick, let's depart: that man has been struck." He contemplated, "Oh, they must possess supernatural abilities." Even though he felt fine, they insisted he was injured. Upon their return to Egulac, the young man returned to his abode and ignited a fire. He narrated his experience, stating, "Behold, I journeyed with the supernatural beings, and we fought. Many of our comrades perished, and many of those we combatted also fell. They alleged I was wounded, but I didn't feel unwell." He divulged his entire account and then fell silent. As the sun emerged, he expired. Something sinister emerged from his mouth. His countenance twisted. The people wailed and sobbed. He was deceased. ##TEXTEND##

##TEXT## Two young individuals from Egulac decided to visit the river one evening to hunt seals. Suddenly, the weather became foggy and quiet. They heard strange noises, making them wonder, "Maybe it's a war party." They retreated to the shore, hiding behind a log. Soon, canoes appeared, making a lot of noise. They saw a canoe with five men getting closer. The men suggested, "What do you think? We want to take you with us. We're going upriver to fight a tribe." One of the young men said, "I don't have arrows." They replied, "The canoe has arrows." He replied, "I won't go. I might get killed. My family doesn't know where I am. But you," he said to the other, "can go with them." So, one young man agreed, while the other went back home. The warriors traveled upriver to a village beyond Kalama. They fought near the water, causing many injuries. Suddenly, a warrior shouted, "Hurry, let's leave: that man has been hit." He thought, "Oh, they must have special powers." Even though he felt fine, they insisted he was hurt. When they returned to Egulac, the young man went back home and lit a fire. He told his story, saying, "Look, I went with the special beings, and we fought. Many of our friends died, and many of those we fought against also died. They claimed I was hurt, but I didn't feel bad." He shared everything and then became quiet. As the sun rose, he died. Something evil came out of his mouth. His face changed. The people cried and screamed. He was dead. ##TEXTEND##

##TEXT## Two individuals hailing from Egulac chose to journey to the river for a night of seal hunting. As the night grew foggy and quiet, they began to hear unusual noises, causing them to contemplate, "Could this be a war party?" they quickly retreated to the shore, concealing themselves behind a log. Soon, canoes filled with commotion approached. In one canoe, five men were visibly present. The men proposed, "What are your thoughts? We wish to take you along. We're headed upriver to engage in battle with a tribe." One young man expressed, "I lack arrows." They responded, "The canoe carries arrows." He declined, "I won't go. I might meet my demise. My family is unaware of my whereabouts. However, you," he said addressing the other, "can accompany them." Thus, one young man agreed, while the other returned home. The warriors voyaged upriver to a village beyond Kalama, where they engaged in combat near the water, resulting in numerous injuries. A warrior abruptly exclaimed, "Quickly, let's depart: that man has been struck." He pondered, "Oh, they must possess extraordinary abilities." Despite feeling unscathed, they insisted he was injured. Upon their return to Egulac, the young man returned home and ignited a fire. He recounted his tale, saying, "Behold, I ventured with the extraordinary beings, and we fought. Many of our acquaintances perished, as did many of those we combatted. They claimed I was injured, but I felt nothing." He detailed everything and then fell silent. As dawn broke, he passed away. A malevolent force emerged from his mouth. His countenance altered. The people wailed and shrieked. He was no more. ##TEXTEND##

As they journeyed upstream, they encountered a hostile group near Kalama, leading to several injuries. A warrior suggested, 'We should leave soon. He seems unwell.' They decided to reveal his wound as a possible threat to their enemies. Upon their return to Egulac, the young one returned, started a fire, and shared his experiences. He stated, 'I journeyed with these fierce people and fought. Many fell on both sides.' He recounted the entire incident and then fell silent. At sunrise, he passed away, and the villagers mourned his loss. ##TEXTEND##

##TEXT## Two individuals from Egulac stealthily embarked on a sealing trip one evening, hiding near the shoreline behind a log. They spotted five individuals in canoes generating unusual sounds. One suggested, 'Maybe we should navigate upstream and connect with another community.' The other responded, 'I'm almost out of arrows.' They proposed, 'There are plenty in the canoe.' He objected, 'I can't continue. My family is unaware I've left.' He suggested, 'You could go with them.' One of the younger ones opted to join them, while the other chose to return home. As they traveled upstream, they encountered a menacing group near Kalama, resulting in several injuries. A warrior proposed, 'We should depart shortly. He seems ill.' They chose to expose his injury as a potential danger to their opponents. Upon their return to Egulac, the young one returned, initiated a fire, and shared his adventure. He declared, 'I journeyed with these fierce people and battled. Many perished on both sides.' He narrated the entire ordeal and then fell quiet. At dawn, he expired, and the villagers mourned his demise. ##TEXTEND##
